events.title: German 'hammer gang' trial for seven accused of extreme-left violence
events.summary: The trial in Dresden comes shortly after the US designated the Antifa Ost group as a terrorist organisation.
events.impact_summary: The trial in Dresden comes shortly after the US designated the Antifa Ost group as a terrorist organisation.

events.title: Same-sex marriage must be respected throughout EU, top court tells Poland
events.summary: The ruling covers the case of a Polish couple who married in Berlin but Polish authorities refused to recognise their marriage.
events.impact_summary: The ruling covers the case of a Polish couple who married in Berlin but Polish authorities refused to recognise their marriage.

events.title: What is Cartel de los Soles, which the US is labelling as a terrorist organisation?
events.summary: The US says it is headed by Venezuela's president and other senior politicians, but some analysts say it does not even exist.
events.impact_summary: The US says it is headed by Venezuela's president and other senior politicians, but some analysts say it does not even exist.

events.title: Machu Picchu hit by a row over tourist buses
events.summary: Protests have taken place over the coaches that take visitors up to the world heritage site in Peru.
events.impact_summary: Protests have taken place over the coaches that take visitors up to the world heritage site in Peru.

events.title: Is Africa's solar power revolution finally happening?
events.summary: Chinese solar equipment has been flooding African markets, partly as a ripple effect of the US-China trade war. It's one of several factors helping the continent gain traction with electrification.
events.impact_summary: Chinese solar equipment has been flooding African markets, partly as a ripple effect of the US-China trade war. It's one of several factors helping the continent gain traction with electrification.

events.title: Nigeria: Millions to face severe hunger as WFP funds run out
events.summary: The UN food assistance agency warned that nearly 35 million people in Nigeria could face severe food insecurity in 2026. The country is seeing escalating jihadi violence and mass kidnappings of schoolchildren.
events.impact_summary: The UN food assistance agency warned that nearly 35 million people in Nigeria could face severe food insecurity in 2026. The country is seeing escalating jihadi violence and mass kidnappings of schoolchildren.

events.title: Pakistan strikes Afghanistan, kills 9 children, Taliban says
events.summary: Airstrikes in Khost province killed a woman and nine children, a Taliban spokesperson said. This came a day after a suicide bombing in Peshawar, Pakistan, city killed three and injured at least 11.
events.impact_summary: Airstrikes in Khost province killed a woman and nine children, a Taliban spokesperson said. This came a day after a suicide bombing in Peshawar, Pakistan, city killed three and injured at least 11.

events.title: Zambia: Hope in the fight against gender-based violence
events.summary: According to the 2024 Zambia Demographic and Health Survey, half of all women have experienced physical, emotional or sexual violence. Experts warn the true number is likely higher. But change is on the horizon.
events.impact_summary: According to the 2024 Zambia Demographic and Health Survey, half of all women have experienced physical, emotional or sexual violence. Experts warn the true number is likely higher. But change is on the horizon.

events.title: Japan's work-life balance at risk under new PM
events.summary: Japan's new prime minister has vowed to "work, work, work," even on two hours of sleep. Critics warn her stance could revive toxic overtime culture and reverse progress on reducing deaths from overwork.
events.impact_summary: Japan's new prime minister has vowed to "work, work, work," even on two hours of sleep. Critics warn her stance could revive toxic overtime culture and reverse progress on reducing deaths from overwork.

events.title: Green notification for tropical cyclone KOTO-25. Population affected by Category 1 (120 km/h) wind speeds or higher is 0  (2.031 million in Tropical Storm).
events.summary: From 24/11/2025 to 25/11/2025, a Tropical Storm (maximum wind speed of 111 km/h) KOTO-25 was active in NWPacific. The cyclone affects these countries: Philippines, Viet Nam (vulnerability High). Estimated population affected by category 1 (120 km/h) wind speeds or higher is 0  (2.031 million in tropical storm).
